data.event: It was a well-to-do quarter during 13thâ€“15th centuries, when it really was by the sea shore, and the area that today is named Barceloneta was still an island.

Another place of interest is the Fossar de les Moreres, the site of a mass grave of Catalan soldiers fallen during the siege of 1714, which ended with the fall of Barcelona and the end of the War of the Spanish Succession.
